issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify getTotalNumberOfStudents() should return an int (and no StudentCount class is mentioned), but in the solution repository Lecture.getTotalNumberOfStudents() returns a StudentCount object and introduces a StudentCount class. This mismatches the expected signature and omits from the template, confusing students who will implement an int-returning method with no StudentCount provided.
issues.suggested_fix: Either change the solution’s getTotalNumberOfStudents() to return an int (and remove the StudentCount class) to match the UML and template, or update the problem statement, UML diagram, and template to introduce and use StudentCount consistently.

issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify that getTotalNumberOfStudents() should return an int, but the solution implements it to return a StudentCount object (introducing a new class name StudentCount not mentioned in the exercise). This misalignment forces students to map a primitive int concept to a custom wrapper class, creating unnecessary confusion.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the solution’s getTotalNumberOfStudents() signature to return an int (sum of students) instead of StudentCount, removing the StudentCount class or renaming it to match the primitive return type expected.
